{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2015}} {{Infobox person | name = Abby Elliott | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birthname = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1987|6|16|aged 30}} | birth_place = [[Manhattan, New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | education = [[Immaculate High School]] | alma_mater = [[Marymount Manhattan College]] | home_town = [[Wilton, Connecticut]], U.S. | occupation = [[Actress]], [[comedian]] | yearsactive = 2006–present | spouse = {{Marriage|Bill Kennedy|2016|}} | parents = Paula Niedert
[[Chris Elliott]] | relatives = [[Bob Elliott (comedian)|Bob Elliott]] (grandfather)
Bridey Elliott (sister) }} '''Abby Elliott''' (born June 16, 1987) is an American actress and comedian who was a cast member on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' for four seasons (from 2008 to 2012) and co-starred on the [[Bravo (U.S. TV network)|Bravo]] series ''[[Odd Mom Out]]''. She is the daughter of actor/comedian [[Chris Elliott]]. ==Life and career== Elliott was born in [[New York City]], the elder of two children. She is the daughter of Paula Niedert, a talent coordinator, and actor/comedian [[Chris Elliott]]. Her grandfather is radio comedian [[Bob Elliott (comedian)|Bob Elliott]].{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/29/magazine/29Elliott-t.html?_r=1&ref=todayspaper&pagewanted=all|title=A Professionally Funny Family|last=Zuckerman|first=Ed|work=The New York Times|date=November 11, 2009|accessdate=January 7, 2011}} Her younger sister is actress Bridey Elliott; they were both raised in [[Wilton, Connecticut]].{{cite web|url=http://wilton.dailyvoice.com/neighbors/happy-birthday-wilton-s-abigail-abby-elliott|title=Happy Birthday To Wilton’s Abigail 'Abby' Elliott|date=June 16, 2014|publisher=wilton.dailyvoice.com|accessdate=March 7, 2015}} She attended high school at [[Immaculate High School]] in [[Danbury, Connecticut]], where she acted in school plays and musicals. After graduating from Immaculate High School in 2005, she attended [[Marymount Manhattan College]] in New York City but dropped out during the first semester.{{cite news|last= Nellie|first=Andreeva|title='SNL' taps Abby Elliott, Michaela Watkins |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/snl-taps-abby-elliott-michaela-122861 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=November 12, 2008}} In 2006, Elliott appeared with supporting roles for the [[Television pilot|pilots]] ''You've Reached The Elliotts'' and ''Chrissy: Plain & Simple'', both sitcoms that star her father, Chris Elliott. While at UCBT, she frequently performed with [[The Midnight Show]] sketch troupe. She has also occasionally performed comedy with her younger sister Bridey. Before joining the cast of ''SNL'', Elliott had also done guest voices roles on ''[[King of the Hill]]'' and ''[[Minoriteam]]''.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2008/scene/news/elliott-watkins-join-snl-cast-1117995768/|title=Elliott, Watkins join ‘SNL’ cast|last=Littleton|first=Cynthia|date=November 12, 2008|publisher=variety.com|accessdate=March 7, 2015}} She has also been featured in a number of ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]'' sketches such as "Jersey Floor" and "Studio 6-Bee".{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jimmy-fallon-jersey-shore-186198|title=Tina Fey, Amy Poehler, Jimmy Fallon Mock NBC in 'Jersey Shore' Spoof (Video)|last=Power|first=Lindsay|date=May 6, 2011|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=March 7, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2010/02/02/glee-jimmy-fallon-studio-6-bee|title=Jimmy Fallon parodies 'Glee': Living on a prayer for cue cards|last=Barrett|first=Annie|date=February 2, 2010|publisher=ew.com|accessdate=March 7, 2015}} Elliott made her film debut with a small role in ''[[No Strings Attached (film)|No Strings Attached]]'' and has since had supporting roles in the films ''[[High Road (film)|High Road]]'' and ''[[Fun Size]]''.{{cite web|title=Exclusive: Abby Elliott on Her New Movie, A Role on 'How I Met Your Mother,' and Leaving 'SNL'|url=http://www.elle.com/news/culture/abby-elliott-interview-fun-size-saturday-night-live|accessdate=October 12, 2012|work=Elle}}{{cite news|url=http://www.irishnews.com/features/not-so-fun-size-comedy-1202690 |title=Not so Fun Size comedy |work=[[The Irish News]] |date=November 2, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140107212700/http://www.irishnews.com/features/not-so-fun-size-comedy-1202690 |archivedate=January 7, 2014 }} Since leaving ''SNL'' in 2012, Elliott has made guest appearances on television programs such as ''[[2 Broke Girls]]'', ''[[How I Met Your Mother]]'', ''[[Happy Endings (TV series)|Happy Endings]]'', and ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]''.{{cite web|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2012/12/14/happy-endings-abby-elliott/|title=Happy Endings -- Abby Elliott to guest star - Inside TV - EW.com|work=EW.com|accessdate=December 15, 2014}} From 2015 to 2017, she co-starred on the [[Bravo (U.S. TV network)|Bravo]] series ''[[Odd Mom Out]]''. ===''Saturday Night Live''=== Elliott joined the cast of ''SNL'' midway through the [[Saturday Night Live (season 34)|2008–2009 season]] (season 34), in November 2008, following the departure of [[Amy Poehler]]. She is the third generation of her family to have been featured on ''SNL'' (the second to be hired as a cast member, and her tenure on the show was longer than both her father and grandfather). Her father Chris Elliott was an ''SNL'' cast member during the [[Saturday Night Live (season 20)|1994–1995 season]] (season 20) and her grandfather Bob Elliott was one half of the popular comedy duo [[Bob & Ray]]. Bob Elliott co-starred on a Christmas episode in the [[Saturday Night Live (season 4)|1978–1979 season]] (fourth season). After four seasons on ''SNL'', Elliott was let go from the show prior to its [[Saturday Night Live (season 38)|38th season]]. ====Celebrity impressions on ''SNL''==== *[[Zooey Deschanel]] *[[Angelina Jolie]] *[[Anna Faris]] *[[Khloé Kardashian]] *[[Meryl Streep]] *[[Rachel Maddow]] *[[Rosie Pope]] *[[Katy Perry]] *[[Brittany Murphy]] *[[Sarah McLachlan]] *[[Ke$ha]] *[[Christina Aguilera]] *[[Anne Hathaway]] *[[Joan Cusack]] *[[Sally Field]] *[[Leah Remini]] *[[Nancy Grace]] *[[k.d. lang]] *[[Kate Middleton]] *[[Shaun White]] ====Recurring characters on ''SNL''==== *Shirley, one of the singing sisters on ''[[The Lawrence Welk Show]]''. *One of the French girls in "Les Jeunes de Paris". *Fur Coat Rhonda, one of the comedians in "The Original Kings of Catchphrase Comedy". *Paula, one of Gilly's classmates that always tattles on her. ==Personal life== In 2010, Elliott dated fellow ''Saturday Night Live'' cast member [[Fred Armisen]].{{cite news|last1=Oh|first1=Eunice|last2=Triggs|first2=Charlotte|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20414197,00.html |title=Fred Armisen and Abby Elliott's Relationship in 'Early Stages'|newspaper=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 19, 2010}} They ended their relationship in September 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20532202,00.html|title=Fred Armisen and Abby Elliott Split|last=Triggs|first=Charlotte|date=September 27, 2011|publisher=people.com|accessdate=March 7, 2015}} Elliott married television writer Bill Kennedy on September 3, 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.theknot.com/news/abby-elliott-shares-beautiful-proposal-story-there-were-flowers-everywhere-3757|title=Abby Elliott Shares "Beautiful" Proposal Story|date=January 26, 2016|publisher=}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film ! Year ! Title !
